910601-d-06-01-91-AZER.Narrative: INITIAL ESTIMATE OF DAMAGE WAS $26,000 TO LOCOMOTIVE AND $18,000 TO CARS. LATER DETAILED INSPECTIONOF LOCOMOTIVE DAMAGE INDICATED FRAME DEFECTS RESULTING IN EQUIPMENT DAMAGE AT THE LEVEL BEING REPORTED IN ITEM 33. CONDUCTOR WAS LINING SWITCH ON GROUND AND WAS NOT ON CONSIST WHERE HE COULD PREVENT ANY POSSIBLE MISHAP. THIS TYPE OF INCIDENT WAS REASONABLE CAUSE FOR D&A TESTING UNDER RULE G AS WE DETERMINED THAT FRA THRESHOLDS HAD NOT BEEN MET FOR TOXICOLOGICAL TESTING. FAILURE TO SEAL SAMPLES ATTHE COLLECTION FACILITY BY HOSPITAL PERSONNEL MADE THE COLLECTION INVALID. DUE TO COLLECTION FACILITY ERROR, WE ARE UNABLE TO DETERMINE THAT D&A IMPAIRMENT IS A CONTRIBUTING CAUSE OF THIS ACCIDENT. ENGINEER HAS RESIGNED RATHER THAN FACE INVESTIGATION AND ANY POSSIBLE DISCIPLINE. CONDUCTOR WAIVED INVESTIGATION AND ACCEPTED DISCIPLINE ACCORDING TO COMPANY POLICIES.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone
